Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The spectrum of PAX6 mutations in aniridia patients is highly biased , with 92 % of all reported mutations leading to premature truncation of the protein ( nonsense , splicing , insertions and deletions ) and just 2 % leading to substitution of one amino acid by another ( missense ) .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Aniridia |
| PAX6-related Aniridia (due to PAX6 mutations) |

The paragraph is primarily discussing the types of mutations in the PAX6 gene that cause Aniridia. Therefore, Aniridia is the primary disease entity mentioned in the paragraph, and PAX6-related Aniridia is a more specific subtype of the disease caused by PAX6 mutations.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Aniridia |
| PAX6-related Aniridia |

The paragraph specifically mentions Aniridia and PAX6-related Aniridia as diseases or conditions. Other terms such as "mutations," "nonsense," "splicing," "insertions and deletions," and "missense" are not diseases but rather types or causes of the diseases mentioned.
